meanings.definition: To convert a message into a different code.
meanings.sent1: She recodes the secret message to keep it safe.
meanings.sent2: The software recodes the information for security purposes.
meanings.sent3: He recodes the note in a playful cipher for his friend to decipher.
meanings.sent4: The artist recodes reality into abstract forms in her paintings.
meanings.sent5: Recoding the data transforms it into a new language of numbers.

meanings.definition: To alter or revise a genetic code.
meanings.sent1: Scientists recode DNA to study genetic mutations.
meanings.sent2: The geneticist recodes the gene sequence to correct errors.
meanings.sent3: The mad scientist recodes the DNA of a tomato to make it glow.
meanings.sent4: Nature recodes genes like a master editor crafting a novel.
meanings.sent5: Recoding the genetic information can lead to new discoveries in medicine.

meanings.definition: To change the format or structure of data.
meanings.sent1: The programmer recodes the software to improve its performance.
meanings.sent2: Companies often recode databases to enhance efficiency.
meanings.sent3: She recodes the spreadsheet to create colorful graphs for the presentation.
meanings.sent4: Time recodes memories, distorting them like an old film reel.
meanings.sent5: Recoding the files can make them easier to access and understand.
